ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course, I think it will be very useful for work in the social sciences down the line. The professor does a great job of making the courses interesting even when the material can be dry some of the time.
Good course for econometrics, second half may be hard for people without background.

For students outside of the IDE program I would recommend the class only with the warning that if they haven't much of a technical background, or have little econometrics, it will seem a very challenging course and is focused more on the theoretical aspects than the practical aspects that might be desirable if a general 'working knowledge' of econometrics is sought.
Summary: a crash-course in econometrics. Personally, I would be hesitant in recommending the course to others, without knowing their prior background in the related field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think it will be very good to have the knowledge of this course for the rest of the year in IDE.
Having no previous econometrics experience the course certainly introduced me to the field and the key theoretical aspects of it.
